00015                          * For 'timeval'

00020 # else

00022 # endif

00028 #  include <time.h>

00048 #ifndef MAX_SUBID               /* temporary - duplicate definition protection */
00049 #ifndef EIGHTBIT_SUBIDS
00050 typedef u_long  oid;
00051 #define MAX_SUBID   0xFFFFFFFF
00052 #else
00053 typedef u_char  oid;
00054 #define MAX_SUBID   0xFF
00055 #endif
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifndef HAVE_SOCKLEN_T
00059 typedef u_int socklen_t;
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #ifndef HAVE_IN_ADDR_T
00063 typedef u_int in_addr_t;
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #ifndef HAVE_SSIZE_T
00067 #if defined(__INT_MAX__) && __INT_MAX__ == 2147483647
00068 typedef int ssize_t;
00069 #else
00070 typedef long ssize_t;
00071 #endif
00072 #endif
00073 
00074     /*
00075      * Try to ensure we have 32-bit (and hopefully 64-bit)
00076      *    integer types available.
00077      */
00078 #ifndef HAVE_INT32_T
00079 #if   SIZEOF_INT == 4
00080 typedef int int32_t
00081 #elif SIZEOF_LONG == 4
00082 typedef long int32_t
00083 #elif SIZEOF_SHORT == 4
00084 typedef short int32_t
00085 #else
00086 typedef int int32_t
00087 #define _INT32_IS_NOT_32BIT
00088 #endif
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 #ifndef HAVE_UINT32_T
00092 #ifdef HAVE_U_INT32_T
00093 typedef u_int32_t        uint32_t
00094 #else
00095 typedef unsigned int32_t uint32_t
00096 #endif
00097 #endif
00098 
00099 #ifndef HAVE_INT64_T
00100 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
00101 typedef long int64_t
00102 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
00103 typedef long long int64_t
00104 #elif   SIZEOF_INT == 8
00105 typedef int int64_t
00106 #elif SIZEOF_LONG >= 8
00107 typedef long int64_t
00108 #define _INT64_IS_NOT_64BIT
00109 #else
00110 #define _NO_64BIT_TYPE 1
00111 #endif
00112 #endif
00113 
00114 #ifndef HAVE_UINT64_T
00115 #ifdef HAVE_U_INT64_T
00116 typedef u_int64_t        uint64_t
00117 #elif !defined(_NO_64BIT_TYPE)
00118 typedef unsigned int64_t uint64_t
00119 #endif
00120 #endif
00121 
00122     /*
00123      *  For the initial release, this will just refer to the
00124      *  relevant UCD header files.
00125      *    In due course, the types and structures relevant to the
00126      *  Net-SNMP API will be identified, and defined here directly.
00127      *
00128      *  But for the time being, this header file is primarily a placeholder,
00129      *  to allow application writers to adopt the new header file names.
00130      */
00131 
00132 
00133 #include <net-snmp/definitions.h>
00134 #include <net-snmp/library/snmp_api.h>
00135 /*
00136  * #include <net-snmp/library/libsnmp.h> 
00137  */

00139     typedef struct netsnmp_index_s {
00140        int          len;
00141        oid         *oids;
00142     } netsnmp_index;
00143 
00144 
00145     typedef struct netsnmp_void_array_s {
00146        size_t  size;
00147        void * *array;
00148     } netsnmp_void_array;
00149 
00150     /*
00151      * references to various types
00152      */
00153     typedef struct netsnmp_ref_void {
00154        void * val;
00155     } netsnmp_ref_void;
00156 
00157 #if 0

00159        u_char * val;

00163        char * val;

00167        int val;
00168     } netsnmp_ref_int;
00169 
00170     typedef struct netsnmp_ref_u_int_s {
00171        u_int val;
